job.title: Machine Learning Engineer
job.description: We have an exciting opportunity available for a Machine Learning Engineer within our PwC Waterfall or Cape Town office. You will design and build new Data Science/Machine Learning (“ML”) software solutions while participating in all phases of the software development lifecycle. Your ultimate goal is to create high-quality software solutions that meet clients needs. Requirements: BSc, BEng, or BIT degree, preferably with Postgraduate degrees, strong foundational Computer Science knowledge required Experience in the design, development and deployment of Machine Learning solutions Minimum 4 years total working experience with 2+ years of experience in developing Machine Learning solutions Extensive Python development experience with experience in creating ML pipelines Extensive knowledge of Docker/containerisation, experience with deployment on Kubernetes will be highly advantageous Database design patterns & object relational mapping in Python Experience with Git & collaborative software development Test driven development Experience in MLOps will be highly advantageous Responsibilities: Assist in designing and implementing functional application requirements for client-facing and internal ML solutions Ownership of the delivery of functional aspects of an application design in line with functional specification as part of a larger multi-disciplinary team Guidance and upskilling of junior ML team members on various aspects of the machine learning development lifecycle Guidance to wider team members on various aspects of the ML application development lifecycle Collaborate with Data Engineers to ensure data and data structures cater for solution needs Collaborate with UX/UI designers to specify UI requirements for application designs Collaborate with Front-End developers to ensure accurate delivery of UI application specifications Build of efficient back-end application features Manage application testing and bug fixes Prepare technical documentation Implement software enhancements and suggest improvements Review code from other developers and team members Please apply via LinkedIn.
